bug.author: kinghuang
bug.summary: Trailing slash required if using --server.baseUrlPath, but not shown in output
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
If the --server.baseUrlPath option is set, the corresponding request to Streamlit must have a trailing slash in order to match the generated routes. But, the instructions shown do not include the trailing slash. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Given a server.baseUrlPath of abc, /abc, abc/, or /abc/: <denchmark-code>root@c1b5a837975b:/project# streamlit run --server.baseUrlPath abc/ sa/gui.py
You can now view your Streamlit app in your browser.
Network URL: http://172.19.0.2:8501/abc External URL: http://209.89.162.170:8501/abc </denchmark-code>
Both Network URL and External URL show the URL without a trailing slash. But, the server is only listening for requests with the slash. <denchmark-code>‣ ~ http -h http://127.0.0.1:8501/abc HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found ‣ ~ http -h http://127.0.0.1:8501/abc/ HTTP/1.1 200 OK </denchmark-code>
Here's the underlying route generated in the Server class. <denchmark-code>('^/abc/(.*)/?$', …) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
I think Streamlit should be forgiving and do a redirect from /abc to /abc/. The output should also include the trailing slash. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
If I literally use the URLs as shown, I get a 404 Not Found error. <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
No. Streamlit did not support custom base paths before 0.49.0. <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: Streamlit, version 0.49.0 (with #523 applied) Python version: Python 3.8.0 Using Conda? PipEnv? PyEnv? Pex? pip OS version: macOS Mojave 10.14.6 Browser version: curl 7.54.0
